item.description: Refer to this repository for solution scripts and the IPython Notebook pertaining to the explanations here. Challenge 9: Implement PKCS#7 padding Link A block cipher transforms a fixed-sized block (usually 8 or 16 bytes) of plaintext into ciphertext. But we almost never want to transform a single block; we encrypt irregularly-sized messages. One way we account for irregularly-sized messages is by padding, creating a plaintext that is an even multiple of the blocksize.

You’ll need to use this code for the rest of the exercises. Data, essentially raw bytes/binary (0, 1), can be represented in various forms and formats as required. These representations may be used for simply the presentation of data, or may be required by some protocol so as to prevent misinterpretation of data.
